byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ben Hubbard from Urfa, Turkey; Omar al-Jawoshy from Baghdad; and Anne Barnard and Maher Samaan from Beirut, Lebanon.

abstract: Many Iraqi commanders and some American officers say caution by United States in using airstrikes against Islamic State is giving terrorists the upper hand; US officials say airstrikes of significant and obvious ISIS targets would accidentally kill civilians.
lead_paragraph: Many Iraqi commanders and some American officers say that exercising caution with airstrikes has harmed the coalition’s larger effort to destroy the Islamic State.

headline.main: U.S. Caution in Strikes Gives ISIS an Edge, Many Iraqis Say
headline.print_headline: U.S. Caution in Strikes Gives ISIS an Edge, Many Iraqis Say

snippet: Many Iraqi commanders and some American officers say that exercising caution with airstrikes has harmed the coalition’s larger effort to destroy the Islamic State.
